name: Iberostar Costa Dorada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here Jan 7-13th and chose this resort after reading reviews.
reviews.title: Not 4-5 stars...but it grows on you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort was actually MUCH smaller than I imagined based on reviews and resort maps. That said-the beach seems quite large with plenty of chairs.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Was initially disappointed in the outdated look of the rooms-not that we stay in the rooms for long periods-usually just to sleep. The pool is also smaller than the pictures you see. I did not however, see a strange "green color" to the water. There WAS some algae around the walls of the pool and they did their best to scrub it off daily. I think perhaps they just need stronger chemicals.
reviews.title: great value, very pleasant experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The animation team made the resort MUCH more fun than it would have otherwise been. Overall, I dodnt pay too much attention as my kids are older but it made a difference this trip.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: So basically, There is a large beach area with volleyball, games area, BBQs, archery, etc, then there are 9 hotel buildings surrounding the pool, a lobby bar, a pool snack bar/ buffet (but no swim up bar), a Buffet restaurant and 3 specialty restauants. You can make 3 reservations over the course of a week-though all specialty restaurants seemed to have openings all week.
reviews.title: Great all-inclusive hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this hotel after it was recommended by friends. Lived up to our expectations and have just returned from a 2 week stay.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are clean and have everything you need (bit dated but not a problem) and any issues were addressed immediately.
reviews.title: Not 5 Star in my experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Buffet restaurants have a huge variety of lovely food and cater for all tastes. Speciality restaurants are well worth a visit - and the musicians were lovely!
reviews.title: Keep going back...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Entertainment staff were really good and all staff were genuinely friendly and happy to help.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would not hesitate to recommend
reviews.title: Our Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a good holiday 29th Jan. This hotel is definately for families or a group of friends. The Hotel is very impressive in the reception area with very friendly and helpful staff. It isnt a 5 star hotel but nothing is too much trouble. The food is good and tries to cater for all tastes. I was a little disappointed with the room they definately need to be refurbished but on the other hand they were kept very clean. The entertainment was sometimes very repetitive but every effort was made by the staff to make the best of it.
reviews.title: Family holiday lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010
reviews.text: My main disappointment was with the beach and the sea, they have got a problem with seaweed although they do try to clear it, they dont alway succeed. You do have to fight it slighty when you enter the sea. The part of the beach which is not looked after by the 2 hotels is quite unpleasant with plastic bottles and other rubbish shrewn there, its a lovely stretch of beach but you cant walk too far before coming into contact with rubbish WAS A SHAME. My partner and I did have a relaxing time but am not convinced we chose the best place as a couple. To sum up I would not return to the hotel mainly because of the run down rooms and the seaweed, but I would like to say that we were well looked after.
reviews.title: Fabulous Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed from Jan 16 to Jan 23
reviews.title: Perfect for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went with 10 other people
reviews.title: Nice 4 * Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Short trip from the airport (20 - 30 minutes )
reviews.title: Nice hotel shame about the Weather!!!!!!
first class!!!
reviews.text: my girlfriend and i have just returned from the dominican iberostar today. 2 weeks just isnt enough we had an absolute ball from start to finish. the food, the people, the atmosphere, the pink flamengos (i think thats what they were!) everything was brilliant to much to mention. the rooms are very clean and the security is first class. when u are getting transfered from the airport u r already checked in so u can just go straight to your room when u arrive. the dominican people take so much pride in everything they do, they are so friendly and are such a good laugh all the time even despite of the long hours they work and the little pay they get so if u get the chance go to this hotel! special hotel for a special girlfriend! go go go

reviews.title: A perfect anniversary gift
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned on the 23rd. after spending one week at the resort. It was our ten year anniversary and we couldn't have spent it in a better place. The resort was beautifully landscaped. Food and drinks was excellent. Though I have seen a better beach, there was nothing wrong with this one. Staff were great, however I would like to see the male star friends to stop spanking men's butts. Went to the mall and was able to get a better peso exchange (resort gives 43 peso's per us dollar, Western Union gives 47.5 peso's per us dollar) ask apple's rep to give directions. Mall has much cheaper rates on excursions, however I did not take any offers from them. My wife and I took a cab tour of puerto plata and then was taken to the cable car which we rode to the top of the mountain. cable car costs $4 us dollars for roundtrip (beautiful trees and such, wish we could have spent more time.) The same items the resort sells you can buy at the mall for cheaper rates. Didn't need the thermo cups. Though one could find complaints in any resort, the few I had at this resort were nothing to write about. I picked this resort because of the cheap price and for what the resort had to offer. You can not go wrong with this resort.

reviews.title: You must book this place
reviews.text: Superb, Paradise, is what I would call this place. The swimming pool is glorious and is being cleaned constantly by members of the staff. There is some debri floating about but this would be expected because of the well groomed Gardens surrounding the pool. The staff are fantastic at this hotel and are always happy to smile and talk to you. The food in all resturaunts was fantastic and on a few occasions I commended the chefs for their efforts.

reviews.title: What a place,Brilliant
reviews.text: Bedrooms etc were cleaned regulary and well. This hotel to walk through inculing down to the beach is a joy and the type of gardens you cannot get tired with.

reviews.title: fun fun fun !
reviews.text: If I were to critisise this hotel in anyway it would be the nightly entertainment, although the staff work very hard and are good at what they do it was not my cup of tea. I also missed the joy of being able to walk out the hotel at night because there was nothing out there. I did 5 excursions in total and was not dissapointed in any of them except the deep sea fishing but that was because i caught nothing. I booked them all through Thomson's and although they were slightly more expensive they were very worth it. I think the best excursion to do was the monster truck safari with the free beer and rum. The trip itself was fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Iberostar from June 21st to June 28th. Third stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: amazing week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whoever complaints about this hotel and service is just a constant complainer and very hard to please. It is a 4 1/2 star hotel so you can't compare to a 4 1/2 star you would get in Canada or States.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In brief form:
reviews.title: ruined weekends !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - E-mailed hotel in advance requesting preference of building and location of room and did not get. Could not accomodate to my request but succeeded at least to get Building 1.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: - No Alarm in rooms
reviews.title: Beyond dissapointed
fantastic time
reviews.text: Been back 1 week now and wish we was still there.there is nothing we could fault from start to end,transfers from airport quick and check in at hotel had no problems.rooms were spotless and kept this way for two weeks by the cleaners,minibar restocked every 2 days.food was good and noone could go hungry here such a wide variety and always fresh and hot at every meal time.waiters in restaurant were great and saved your table after a few nights robert and katia served us excellent.swimming pool was gorgeous and kept clean all the time.entertainment team were the best and never stopped trying to make every one happy special thanks to maria,shakira,santa,sexy face,laptop,gi gi,cappuccino,chucky and conny.the lion king show was amazing and make sure to get a seat early as it gets packed.Helen the thomas cook rep was great and always there to answer any questions.Had a great holiday and even thomas cook cabin crew on way home were great and remembered them as they also stay at this hotel,just shows what a great hotel this is.thank you to everyone in hotel who made our holiday fantastic,we will return

reviews.title: brilliant
reviews.text: The entertainment staff were brilliant you could never be bored during the day there is always something to do. some of the evening shows were a little bit boring but i can't praise the staff enough for the lion king show it was exceptional including most of the children staying in the hotel. Nelson in the resturant was great always getting us a table straight away even if it meant resetting it quickly !!! I had my birthday while there and the maid left me a rose in the room and a cake was delivered to me without request. my daughter loved going to the kids club with connie and maria and gigi, sexy face and laptop kept everyone amused!!!! great time for all!!!

reviews.title: Very dissapointing/ This was my 3rd time!
reviews.text: I only slight downfall although perfectly adiquit i feel that the bathrooms were not 5* as the rest of the hotel was completely

reviews.title: Perfect holiday! Ignore the bad reviews!!!
reviews.text: To start off i went to this resort because i being there before with family and friends, this time around i went with my boyfriend (His first time to the Dominican Republic)! Dislike it big time, thanks god we were there for only 4 nights and 5 days if not we would have being going nuts.

reviews.title: Fantastic Staff
reviews.text: Not much to do and the attentions went from a 5 star to a 1 1/2 stars! The staff wont even pay attention to you if you are not Caucasian, the service was horrible. We were bored out of our mind, the food was always the same and tiring, we were unable to make reservation to A'lacarte restaurants and saw no efforts from the concierge part on accommodating us. The rooms very basic and bland, the shows were putting us to sleep, and the drinks unless you tip well you would be getting watery down drinks.

reviews.title: Beautiful, yummy, family friendly - yay!
reviews.text: My family - partner and I and our 6 year old daughter as well as friends and their 7 and 9 yr old boys just got home from a week at the ICD and we had a great time. The resort is beautiful and well maintained. It's mid-sized and felt really easy to navigate, especially with kids. It's big enough to feel spacious but when at the pool you could see the ocean and the big poolside buffet and the small wee ones pool...all in one glance. It made it feel safer to have the kids be able to go and grab an ice cream or snack and be able to see them.

reviews.title: For the price it is worth a visit but nothing special
reviews.text: My daughter went to the Kids Club a few times - because we had friends with us it wasn't as crutial as our last trip to Cuba on our own. The staff person Connie was really friendly and great with the kids. The mini disco's at night were a bit unpredictable - depending on kid turnout so sometimes a much-anticipated theme didn't happen but there was always something fun going on.

reviews.title: Costa Dorara in 2012
reviews.text: We were really happy about the food - we knew that we weren't going to the a la carte restaurants with our kids (sanity choice) so we stuck to the main buffet, the poolside buffet and the beach bbq. There was lots of choice - everything felt fresh and well prepared. The meat and fish were amazing - especially the roast beef, ribs, grilled swordfish - yum. Lots of veggies and vegetarian options for those so inclined. It felt possible to eat really healthy here (not saying I did all the time but the choices were there :) The kids liked the pizza, fries, pancakes and waffles and eggs, nachos, the self serve popcorn and ice cream, etc. The only issue we ever had was because three of our group got sick (not from the DR, a bug from Canada) and couldn't come to dinner and there was a bit of a hassle about us bringing food to the room for them but it got worked out.

reviews.title: New Year 2012/13
reviews.text: The rooms were comfortable and the beds were great - and I say that as someone who is not small and has back problems. The air conditioning worked (when you figured out that the patio doors needed to be locked for it to kick on!) and ceiling fan was often all we needed. Housekeeping kept things neat and tidy for us although we were grateful for the candid advice we got from the Transat rep who told us that if you left an item of clothing on a pillow - it was fair game for housekeeping to take it. If you wanted to leave a gift, that's where it should be left and if you happened to leave something there you shoulnd't have - well, we were warned. So, we "lost" one set of pj's. Lesson learned. We never felt the pressure to tip but certainly did tip small amounts and it was appreciated.

reviews.title: Lovely
reviews.text: We had one real disappointment on the trip (other than being sick) which was a Tour excursion but it wasn't the destination that was the problem. We made the mistake of booking it with a operator who had a desk at the hotel but was not our Transat rep. Because we'd been sick we wanted a low key excursion and had heard great things about the Monkey Jungle. We knew it was both a monkey sanctuary as well as a certified zip line course but that we could just opt for the monkeys only. MJ itself is absolutely beautiful and the time we had feeding and visiting with the monkeys was amazing and magical and one of the highlights of our trip. That being said, the rep that sold us the excursion did not tell us that for our $180 US we would go on a bus for an hour, spend an hour waiting, visit the monkeys for 20 magical minutes and then wait for another hour for the zip line folks to finish and then wait a bit more, take the bus home. We were gone for almost 6 hours and it just was an insane amount of money to spend for that short interaction and a bottle of water. The rep said he would help us out when we talked the next day but a couple of days later he was a brick wall and then became pretty rude. In the end, we complained to guest services and I wrote a letter to MJ telling them of what happened and we were given a 25% refund which I appreciated. So, the learning was - if I had had my own transportation and could have just gone for the amazing view and the monkeys and then headed back, I would have been happy as a clam. But the crazy price led me to feel taken advantage of.

reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday
reviews.text: Stayed at Iberostar 25/6/04 - 8/6/04. The purpose of our trip was my daughters wedding, we had 37 people with us, 5 children ages 2 -12, and the rest ages 20,s - 60,s so quite a varying age range. Hotel is great, rooms great, the staff are what makes this hotel. The gardens are beautiful with flamingos turtles, chickens and baby chicks running around and peacocks which are all very tame. The main buffett restaurant has great choices I think if you didnt like anything then you must be difficult to cater for. Went to Brazilian didnt like the food so much as I cant stand rare meat which is how it tends to be cooked there. but if you do then you will like it. Mexican, most of our group liked the mexican, not to spicy, Tropical, this is were we had our wedding reception and on that night the food was great, some of our group went another night and they said it wasnt as nice. We had fantastic weather during our stay only twice rained for a short while.

reviews.title: What Can I Say about this place
reviews.text: Went on the dolphin encounter at Ocean World we all loved that. Flew to the south on the Saona Island trip, I was a bit dissapointed with this as the island last time i visited had beatiful white beaches and clear blue sea after hurricane george the sand has gone further back and revealed a lot of rocks and It was no longer soft sand walking in to the sea. This trip was expensive and probable worth giving a miss., did the outback safari everyone enjoyed this one, some of our group did horse riding, again good reviews, The lads and 1 girl did the white water rafting, they all thought is was great but the only thing with this which they dont tell you is that it takes 3 hours to get there and 3 hours back on coach so its a long day.

reviews.title: Best Week of our Lives!!!!!
reviews.text: kids club is fantastic, Mama Maria and the other helpers do a wonderful job with the kids, my grandaughter age 6 was always there, they looked after her all day, she was in the stage shows on the evening and they even take them to dinner with all the kids if you want them to. all 37 of us will return to this hotel, we miss it already. If anyone wants more info especially on weddings there you can e mail me Thehallsofboro@aol.com

reviews.title: Okay....
reviews.text: I'm Dominican, so I guess you could say that I should have know what to expect. But my girlfriend is Filipino and I wanted her to get to know my country and see the best it has to offer. My family had gone there before, but without me and they all recommended it, as did other people so we decided on the Iberostar in Puerto Plata as our vacation spot.

reviews.title: A hotel chain fully recommended I want to go back now !!!
reviews.text: I can't begin to tell you all about the wonderful time we had together. This hotel was the nicest place I have ever been in and I've been to many nice ones. It starts with the staff. Everyone there is polite and friendly, and always looking to give the guests a great show. There is never a time when you see them all just hanging around and not doing anything, the place is always full of energy and fun.

reviews.title: Fantastic holiday
reviews.text: there is nothing negative we can say about this holiday at all, me and my boyfriend had a fantastic time, the food, rooms and facilities are all excellent and the staff are friendly and efficient. we went and swam with the dolphins and took the jungle safari, both of which were excellent value and a great day out. The day and evening entertainment at the hotel was good, we will definately be going back, i would recommend this holiday to anyone.

reviews.title: Fan-tas-tic!
reviews.text: Just come back from staying at the Iberostar for our honeymoon, what an amazing place. Rooms very clean, restaurant out of this world. The best bit we liked was all the animals around the grounds pink flamingos, turtles, fish, peacocks and baby peacocks, hens & chicks.

reviews.title: Superb place!!
reviews.text: Did 3 trips – Monster truck definitely the best one to go on you visit a school and someone’s home. The only thing about the Dominican is that I was taken ill on the last few days of my holiday I got gastroenteritis which apparently is very common so don’t eat any shellfish!! Had to be admitted to the medical centre which is located inside the hotel, they put me on a few drips and had loads of injections. And in the end I was pleased to go home to my own bed.

reviews.title: Absolutely amazing.....
reviews.text: I would say the hotel is 5 star, lovely people and lovely place. Will be going back but I will be watching what I eat next time. Don’t take any beach towels they provide them at the pool also watch what you take, they charge you 15 dollars every kilo you go over on your return flight home.

reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic - Superb Hotel
reviews.text: Please feel free to email me if you have any questions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel seemed to perfectly meet our needs. We had a group of 7 friends traveling together all with various activities in mind and one person that was in a wheelchair. The resort is very wheelchair friendly, the only really difficult place was the beach. The suite we had was designed for people with physical challenges which was really nice to see.
reviews.title: Great relaxing resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only complaint we really had about any of our suites was that a lot of the outlets have a raised border, making it difficult to plug in any large power cord. We had a few things break on us in different suites but they were excellent about having them repaired right away!!
reviews.title: Not much to do but relax ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outside of the rooms the resort was great! They have a turtle pond as you enter and some flamingos just outside of the amphitheater. The grounds are spacious and have a lot of different things you can do.The pool was enormous! We never had a problem finding chairs or space to relax. The cabanas were a little low but it kept the sun of of those who didn't want to burn. There were a couple of taller huts that we always tried to get as some of the people in our group were fairly tall.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - would rate as a 4 star though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The beach is really nice, but there is a rather large section of coral in the designated swimming area. The water is mostly clean but some litter can be found when swimming. The shoreline at the resort is kept really clean, but if you venture off of the resort you'll soon find a lot of garbage washed up on shore.
reviews.title: fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The nightly show always had a lot of dancing and performing, and the skill level was a lot higher than I was expecting. They tried to vary the type of show nightly to satisfy all ages.I found it hard to understand the MC a lot of the time, but I'm also not the best with accents.
reviews.title: Good value, relaxing getaway
4th return and possibly last
reviews.text: Returned 2 weeks ago from out 4th visit back to ICD.

reviews.title: Our February 2012 Stay
reviews.text: Cannot fault any aspect of the holiday, but although the food as normal was excellent with plenty of choice, we did notice that there did not seem so much. Perhaps due to some cut backs, or the fact that the hotel wasnt at full capacity. What there was, was still very good choice.

reviews.title: Honeymoon from Hell!!
reviews.text: On arrival we were allocated to the room we requested in block 1 ( emailed hotel prior ) and greeted with a bottle of rum and a lovely plate of fruit as we were returning guests. We also had a cocktail party by management to thank us all for returning, and given some gifts and a group photo.

reviews.title: Could not ask for more
reviews.text: We celebrated out anniversary whilst there, and had a bottle of champagne delivered to our room and a turn down service with chocolates left on the pillows in the evening, which was a lovely touch.

reviews.title: Very Relaxing Holiday
reviews.text: We never bother with the entertainment so cannot comment on the star friends, and prefer to sit in the courtyard in the evening, with a drink or 2.

reviews.title: Amazing two weeks
reviews.text: Stayed at hotel from Jan 12 to 26.

reviews.title: Nice resort, decent food, great entertainment staff, not so great beach
reviews.text: It is our 4th time at this hotel.

reviews.title: a complete detailed review
reviews.text: On two trips requested building 1 and were assigned building 2 upon arrival.

reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation!! Would do it again in a heartbeat!!!!!!
reviews.text: Useless to e-mail before for your request.

reviews.title: Iberostar Costa Dorada - A Great Vacation!!!
reviews.text: The weather for the first week was mostly cloudy and chilly. Second week however was good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i have just returned from our honeymoon having stayed for 3 weeks over christmas and new year and all i have to say is, DONT BELIEVE ALL YOU READ.
reviews.title: Left my rose tinted spec's at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our First choice flight arrived 2 hours late due to snow at gatwick only to be met with torrential rain..... transfer to the hotel only took 15 mins and although check in was a bit laboured, we were given a "Honeymoon room" with an "Ocean Veiw" (trought the tree's) The room had a damp smell about it and on closer inspection the wall on the outside of the bathroom had a large dark damp patch. The room was quite large and although basically furnished it had a monster size bed and was very clean. The bathroom on the pther hand was not as good...... the sealant around all the surfaces was either missing, mouldy or had been repaired in small sections..... the mirror had started to lose its silver backing and a slimy rusty looking goo was running from the handle in the bath (i have photo's if you want to see)..... we had issue's with the bathroom throughout our stay, mainly water running down the wall from the room above... the toilet flush handle snapping in two... the tap on the sink leaking in all directions...... on the plus side this is the only hotel i have ever stayed in that has a bath tap that works..... but apart from that and a couple more things that broke or stopped working, everything was sorted out in double quick time.......The room was cleaned every day and fresh towels left . The TV was really poor ....bad reception ....poor channel selection Room had coffee maker and not a kettle so making a tea and a coffee was a struggle unless you used the de-caff coffee sachets ...The air con was very noisy and only had 3 settings cold, very cold, and siberia cold.
reviews.title: Excelent place !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food in the Buffet Restaurant was awesome...... yes they do have the same things for breakfast every day..... Hands up anyone that has a different breakfast everyday at home?????? The choice is vast and you could have a different breakfast everyday if you wanted...... But the same ingredients are there every day..... you are limited only by your imagination.... Lunch and dinner were the same .....your on holiday....try something different.... The waiting staff are fantastic and so attentive, always smiling always happy no matter how rude some people chose to be....Look out for Joseph, Domingo, and Nelson..... really really nice people..... The hotel has 3 al-a-carte restaurants but we never felt the need to use them as you can get fillet steak, lobster and King prawns from the buffet. The hotel only has one main bar open in the evening and thats in the very noisy lobby...... Edwin is the star barman to look out for .... spirits are always served in huge measure's and if you ask nicely you can bypass the local gut rot and get the international brands normally kept out of site...... The beer here is all burps....
reviews.title: Iberostar Costa Dorada- Our home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The animation team are the worst i've ever come across anywhere i've ever been..... Someone turns them on in the morning and they spend the day shouting and Bawling with or without microphones till just before the sun comes up again next day...... There is nowhere you can go to avoid it and get some peace and quiet..... When they do stop for breath its constant music and on a few occasions it actually drown out my mp3.....
reviews.title: Good clean hotel, good food and wonderful pink flamingos in the reception area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The entertainment in the Evening was no better, With the exception of the Lion King the shows, games, dancers and singers were cringemaking, amature and repeated night after night.
reviews.title: A once in a life time experience
The staff here are fantastic and make this hotel as good as it is
reviews.text: We stayed in the Iberostar Costa Dorada for 14 nights and enjoyed every single minute of our time there. Check-in was smooth and uneventful and we were in our rooms within 15 minutes. My first impression of the room was that it was a little bit basic, however, it was always kept spotlessly clean, with the mini bar stocked up with soft drinks every other day and water every day, sheets were clean and towels were always changed. We basically only used the room to get changed and sleep in so, I have absolutely no issues with the room. We never saw any bugs or cockroaches, other than mosquitos, which I expected in a country of this climate.

reviews.title: Fantastic holiday!
reviews.text: Having previously stayed in the Iberostar Punta Cana, which is on a much larger complex, I was a little worried about getting bored during my stay but rest assured the staff here are fantastic and really want you to enjoy your holiday as much as possible - this is what made our holiday so great.

reviews.title: premier price not premier hotel
reviews.text: The Star Friends entertainment team are incredible, they never seem to stop moving, with lots of different activities and things to do during the day.

reviews.title: Fantastic !!!
reviews.text: The entertainers during the day are particularly brilliant and I will mention them because they deserve recognition for the great job that they do. Cappucino, Laptop and Sexyface were faultless in their enthusiasm, friendliness and determination for everyone to have an excellent holiday - they were brilliant.

reviews.title: Great family vacation, like a star !!
reviews.text: Also we need to make a special mention to Santa who worked mostly in the towel hut. She was always happy and smiley which made all the difference early in the morning! On our first afternoon she introduced herself and then during the next two weeks popped over to see how things were going or to see if we wanted to do any of the countless activities and generally just to make sure we had as good a time as possible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at IB Costa Dorada from Jan 16th to Jan 30th,2010.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will write in note form:
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: -Reservations for restuarants are done from 9am to noon.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: _You are allowed to reserve for same day or next 2 following days. Never big line up.
reviews.title: 5 Star exp in a 4 Star setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: -If you reserve for the brazilian or mexican restuarants reservations are either for 6:30 or 8:45. For tropical restuarant you may reserve for 7:15pm.
reviews.title: In Puerto plata for a week end.
great hotel
reviews.text: The iberostar cosat dorada is a really nice hotel, it has large grounds which are full of ponds, flowers, trees, etc.

reviews.title: Great Resort!
reviews.text: the pool area is really nice and never left crowded, there is always something to do and games to play.

reviews.title: Great Relaxing Trip
reviews.text: the entertainment team "star friends" work really hard they are there all day and until at least midnight. cucurulu, wilson, tim, dickson, mitchel, quimo. those guys really do a good job.

reviews.title: One complaint - I had to leave!!!
reviews.text: there is a choice of food for breakfast, lunch and dinner, theres english, german, italian, american, chinese, caribbean, spanish and dominican food.

reviews.title: holiday never to be forgotten
reviews.text: theres a disco at night, which for a hotel disco isnt too bad. althoughthe music is very loud and often ended up with the wrong drink so best to go to the bar just outside the disco to get a drink.

description: Prime beach location. Approximately 5 minutes drive from Puerto Plata. Elegant Caribbean atmosphere. 2 km from the golf course. Top 5-star luxury. Water sports galore.
